headline: Pete Dye, Golf Designer Who Put 1,000 Hazards On 18 Holes, Dies at 94
abstract: “His courses built for tournaments are hard,” Tiger Woods once said, “ but there’s a good reason for everything.”
lead_paragraph: Pete Dye, who designed many of America’s most famous golf courses and became known as the mad scientist of golf architecture for his imaginative and supremely challenging layouts, died on Thursday in the Dominican Republic, the site of several Dye family courses. He was 94.
